MANGA curation

Featuring âBerserk,â âParasyte,â and âUzumaki,â which have long garnered a large following due to their worldview, stories, and artistry, this is a collection of titles selected by UT from the perspective of graphic T-shirts that bring the profound world of MANGA to life.

Hitoshi Iwaaki was born in Tokyo 1960.He debuted in 1985 with âGomi no Umiâ, which was published in the Morning Open supplement.
In 1993, he won the 17th Kodansha Manga Award for âParasyteâ, serialized in Afternoon.His representative works include âParasyteâ, âTanabata no Kuniâ and âHeurekaâ.
He is currently serializing âHistorieâ in Afternoon.It won the grand prize in the manga division of the 14th Japan Media Arts Festival and the â16th Osamu Tezuka Cultural Prize Manga Grand Prizeâ.

Â©Hitoshi Iwaaki/KODANSHA Ltd.

MANGA curation

Featuring âBerserk,â âParasyte,â and âUzumaki,â which have long garnered a large following due to their worldview, stories, and artistry, this is a collection of titles selected by UT from the perspective of graphic T-shirts that bring the profound world of MANGA to life.

Junji Ito was born on July 31st, 1963 in Nakatsugawa, Gifu Prefecture.After graduating from high school, he entered dental technician school and entered the work force. However, when the âMonthly Halloweenâ (Asahi Sonorama) newcomer manga award the âUmezu Awardâ was established, he submitted his work with the single-minded desire to have it read by Kazuo Umezu.
In 1986, he received an honorable mention for his contribution âTomieâ. This was his debut work and became his best-known title.Three years later, he quit his job as a dental technician to concentrate on his manga career.In 1998, he began serializing âUzumakiâ in Weekly Big Comic Spirits (Shogakukan).
Since then, he has continued to publish one-of-a-kind works.
He has won âThe Will Eisner Comic Industry Awardâ, one of the world's most prestigious awards for manga artists, four times in total, and in 2023 received the âSpecial Honors Awardâ at the AngoulÃªme International Manga Festival in France, as well as the âInkpot Awardâ at San Diego Comic-Con in the USA.

Â©Junji ITO/Shogakukan

items.careInstruction:
Recommendations for care:
When using a washing machine, select a cold temperature setting and cycle with lowest spin. No Tumbler/Dryer.
Remove your linen quickly from washer.
Adjust it to cut down wrinkles by hand.
Hang it to dry in the shade using a hanger. Avoid direct sunlight.
